are you using compiz? if so there might be a setting in there too
you can use the "windows rules" plugin in compiz to do it
system, preferences, appearance.. last tab.. set it to the middle one
then install the compizconfig-settings manager..
you're welcome
when that is done you'll get a new menu-item in system, preferences called Compizconfig settings manager
near the bottom there is a plugin called window rules
you want to add audacious to the "sticky" line
so click on the plus.. then click the grab-button and click on the audacious window and "+Add"
well.. you can select it by title too.. might be easier
don't forget to enable the plugin when you're done configuring it
